sen.j: 木田氏（きだし）は、日本の氏族の一つ。
sen.e: The Kida clan was one of Japanese shizoku (clan, samurai family).

sen.j: 平安時代後期、美濃国を地盤とする八島氏の一族であった源重長が同国方県郡木田郷（岐阜県岐阜市木田付近）に居住し木田三郎を号したことに始まる。
sen.e: In the late Heian Period, the Kida clan was started when MINAMOTO no Shigenaga, a member of the Yajima clan based in Mino Province, settled down in Kida-go, Katagata District, Mino Province (near Kida, Gifu City, Gifu Prefecture), calling himself Saburo KIDA.

sen.j: 重長の子たちは美濃の源氏として治承・寿永の乱を戦い、木田重広やその甥木田重兼が討死した。
sen.e: Shigenaga's children had fought in the Jisho-Juei Civil War as members of Mino-Genji, resulting in the deaths of Shigehiro KIDA and his nephew Shigekane.

sen.j: 承久の乱では惣領・木田重国とその子木田重知をはじめ一族の者が京方に属して討死した。
sen.e: In the Jokyu War, some members of the clan including Shigekuni KIDA, the heir of the clan, and his son Shigetomo KIDA were killed as they belonged to kyogata (the Kyoto side or supporters of the Imperial court in Kyoto).

sen.e: Also, some members of the clan became priests, including Gangyo (Kenzen) who founded Annyo-in Temple in Kamakura (Kamakura City).

sen.j: 庶流としては、戦国時代 (日本)に今川氏に仕えた三河山本氏が木田氏の一族吉野氏の後裔を称した。
sen.e: Among its branch families was the Mikawa-Yamamoto clan that had served the Imagawa clan in the Sengoku Period (period of warring states), calling themselves the descendants of the Yoshino clan, a member family of the Kida clan.

sen.j: また、『尊卑分脈』では土岐氏の庶流明智氏の系譜を木田氏に連ねるものともしている。
sen.e: "Sonpi Bunmyaku" (a text compiled in the fourteenth century that records the lineages of the aristocracy) states that the family tree of the Akechi clan, a branch family of the Toki clan, is also connected to the Kida clan.

sen.e: In addition, MINAMOTO no Mitsumune (a son of MINAMOTO no Mitsuyasu) who belonged to Mino Genji, too, and committed suicide after the Heiji Disturbance supposedly called himself 'Kida.'
